senselogic.sitevision.api.node

Interface ContentNodeUtil


  • @Requireable(value="ContentNodeUtil")
public interface ContentNodeUtil
    Content Node utility interface.

    A "Content node" (e.g sv:portlet) is a Node that is located in the "content section" of a "Renderable node" (e.g. sv:page).

    This utility is typically used to get the parent of a Content node, either the content parent (typically a sv:layout) or the renderable parent (typically a sv:page).

    The types of a "Content node" is defined in NodeTypeUtil.isAnyContentType(Node). The types of a "Renderable node" is defined in NodeTypeUtil.isAnyRenderableType(Node).

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getContentNodeUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 10.2
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node getContentParent(Node aContentNode)
      Gets the content parent of a given content node.
      Node getRenderableParent(Node aContentNode)
      Gets the renderable parent of a given content node.

    • Method Detail

      • getRenderableParent

        Node getRenderableParent(Node aContentNode)
        Gets the renderable parent of a given content node.

        See NodeTypeUtil.isAnyRenderableType(Node) for what type a "Renderable node" can have.

        Parameters:
        aContentNode - a content node, typically a sv:portlet or sv:layout
        Returns:
        the renderable parent of aContentNode (typically a sv:page), or null if aContentNode has no renderable parent or if current user doesn't have READ permission on the renderable parent

      • getContentParent

        Node getContentParent(Node aContentNode)
        Gets the content parent of a given content node.

        See NodeTypeUtil.isAnyContentType(Node) for what type a "Content node" can have.

        Element disclaimer! The content structure of an Element (sv:moduleElement/sv:moduleElementDraft) potentially differs in the OFFLINE and ONLINE versions. Typically you should not use this method with aContentNode located within an Element.

        Parameters:
        aContentNode - a content node, typically a sv:portlet or sv:layout
        Returns:
        the content parent of aContentNode (typically a sv:layout), or null if aContentNode has no content parent

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
